title: grace
comment: The unmerited favour of God, made known through Jesus Christ, and expressed supremely in the redemption and full forgiveness of sinners through faith in Jesus Christ.

children.title: grace, in OT
children.comment: In the OT, grace is evident in the special relationship between God and his people.

children.title: God's grace was expressed in the covenant relationship
God's grace affirmed
God's grace shown in his compassion
God's grace shown in his readiness to forgive
God's grace shown in his favour, provision and healing
God made his grace known to individuals

seealsos.comment: in the period of the judges

children.title: God's grace implored
grace, and Jesus Christ
children.comment: Grace is demonstrated pre-eminently in Jesus Christ and the work he came to do.

children.title: God's promise of grace has been fulfilled in Jesus Christ
Grace was expressed in Jesus Christ's life and ministry
Grace is demonstrated in Jesus Christ's atoning death on the cross
grace, and salvation
children.comment: Deliverance through Jesus Christ is the result of accepting God's undeserved favour.

children.title: Salvation is all God's doing
There is nothing human beings can do to save themselves
Salvation is not by keeping God's law
Salvation must be accepted as a free gift by faith
grace, and Holy Spirit
children.comment: The Holy Spirit is both an expression of God's grace and the means by which it is experienced.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is himself a gracious gift of God
Through the Holy Spirit God brings believers out of slavery and into his family
Through the Holy Spirit God equips believers to serve him
The Holy Spirit in God's gracious work of redemption
The Holy Spirit in God's gracious work of sanctifying and sustaining his people
grace, and Christian life
children.comment: The Christian life, from its beginning to its end, is totally dependent upon the grace of God.

children.title: God's grace compensates for human weaknesses
Believers are to pray for grace
Christian experience may be summed up in terms of grace
Believers should go on to experience more of God's grace
Believers are enabled to serve Jesus Christ by his grace
God's grace is seen in Christian character, especially in generosity

primaryrefs.comment: Referring to a collection being taken up for the poor Christians in Jerusalem.

children.title: An ongoing experience of God's grace requires the believer's co-operation
grace, in human relationships
children.comment: Undeserved favour or kindness, mercy, compassion and generosity are to be found in human relationships and are strongly encouraged in Scripture.

children.title: Examples of grace in human relationships
Grace in relationships encouraged
Grace in relationships expressed as mercy and compassion
Grace in relationships expressed as generosity and kindness
